heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 13 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (182°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 49.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.6°C), outside temperature (down 3.5°C), and inside temperature (down 1.8°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 1.8°C), cloud levels (up 363 m), outside temperature (up 1.9°C), and inside temperature (up 2.4°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 229.3m lower than yesterday, 0.6m lower than the past week, 362.7m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 1039m and a high of 2260m, averaging 1237.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and very little to no wind will be present. Possible light showers, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and it’s dim outside. Little change in the weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (86%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
